intro: Dryandra tenuifolia var. elegans, commonly known as the slender leaf dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters, with a compact and upright growth habit. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
